text: if you if you come out of the f train at
the last stop here on 170 night street
you can't miss on the wall a big sign
that points to Bishop Malloy retreat
house and monastery and the way that
sign got here of course that this stop
on the subway system was one of the last
stops to be completed in 1950 so there's
two versions I heard that one was that
someone had come here who worked on the
subway system and had that little mosaic
put on the wall the other story I heard
was that one of the priests from the
monastery just got curious one day
walked down to the subway stop and said
what are you doing and he saw some
Italian contractors and and said hey why
don't you do me a favor and put a little
sign up for our monastery and let people
know where we are
well we're called Immaculate Conception
monastery we've been here since nineteen
twenty four the reason we use the term
monastery is that was the term that was
given to this place by the people in the
area actually if our origins are in
Italy we were founded there and in Italy
we're called retreats it would be
immaculate conception retreat to
indicate that it's a place of retreat
where the priest come to get away and
pray and meditate but then they go back
out to work with the people unlike a
monastery where you would just stay in
the monastery and pray all the time and
never leave your message to in Florida
we have a beautiful parish just serving
the needs of the neighborhood we have a
monastery with about thirty priests who
some our chaplains that Creedmore
Psychiatric or professors and
universities some go out preaching the
different parts of the country others
just stay here if someone comes looking
for a person to vent to or to pour out
their troubles to either in confession
or just just to come and speak to a
friendly priest Father Son and Holy
Spirit well the passion is to live here
take a vow of poverty we share
everything in common so our rooms are
rather simple we have a room with it has
a desk it has a chair it has a bed and a
locker and and that's it we have common
bathrooms and showers and common rooms
for recreation and a dining room but our
rooms are rather simple it's a place of
prayer and it's also I think a prey a
place of faith and hope we're not a
business place where a place where
you're reminded of God of bigger things
